articles.content:
Cambodian King to visit DPRK
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- His Majesty Norodom Sihanouk, King of the Kingdom of Cambodia, will soon pay an official goodwill visit to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea at the invitation of Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

Provocateurs warned to pay high price
articles.content:
Provocateurs warned to pay high price
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A revenge-vowing meeting of the students of Kim Chaek University of Technology took place on Saturday.   Speakers said that since June 4 the South Korean authorities have infiltrated battleships into the north side's territorial waters, threatening peaceful fishing boats of the north and obstructing naval vessels of the Korean People's Army from performing a self-defensive patrol duty and are still ceaselessly committing provocations.   
   The touch-and-go situation has been created on the Korean peninsula due to the reckless provocations committed by the South Korean authorities at the instigation of the U.S., they noted, and denounced the aggressors, provocateurs, for trying to put into practice a second war scenario at any cost to obliterate socialist Korea.
   The enemy mistakes the DPRK and its army and misjudges the situation, they said, stressing:   The Korean people and people's army equipped with powerful modern offensive and defensive means will never tolerate the provocative moves of the South Korean ruling quarters.
